greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) read by rows: If k divides n then k-1, otherwise -1.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 1..100 of triangle, flattened
formula: Sum_{k=1..n} T(n,k) = A001065(n). - _Jon E. Schoenfield_, Nov 29 2019
program: (PARI) T(n,k)= if(Mod(n,k)==0, k-1, -1); \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 27 2019
(MAGMA) [(n mod k) eq 0 select k-1 else -1: k in [1..n], n in [1..15]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 27 2019
[[T(n, k) for k in (1..n)] for n in (1..15)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 27 2019
if (n mod k = 0) then return k-1;
Flat(List([1..15], n-> List([1..n], k-> T(n,k) ))); # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 27 2019
results.author: _Mats Granvik_, Apr 08 2010
